raw_text: Hence, if we were given the perfect knowledge of the possible syntactic frames, verbs can be classified into the correct classes almost perfectly (Dorr and Jones, 1996)
clean_text: Hence, if we were given the perfect knowledge of the possible syntactic frames, verbs can be classified into the correct classes almost perfectly (Dorr and Jones, 1996).

citing_paper_authors: Omri, Abend | Roi, Reichart | Ari, Rappoport
raw_text: Dorr and Jones (1996) showed that perfect knowledge of the allowable syntactic frames for a verb allows 98% accuracy in type assignment to Levin classes
clean_text: Dorr and Jones (1996) showed that perfect knowledge of the allowable syntactic frames for a verb allows 98% accuracy in type assignment to Levin classes.

citing_paper_authors: Anna, Korhonen | Yuval, Krymolowski | Zvika, Marx
raw_text: Verb classifications have, in fact, been used to support many natural language processing (NLP) tasks, such as language generation, machine translation (Dorr, 1997), document classification (Klavans and Kan, 1998), word sense disambiguation (Dorr and Jones, 1996) and sub categorization acquisition (Korhonen, 2002)
clean_text: Verb classifications have, in fact, been used to support many natural language processing (NLP) tasks, such as language generation, machine translation (Dorr, 1997), document classification (Klavans and Kan, 1998), word sense disambiguation (Dorr and Jones, 1996) and sub categorization acquisition (Korhonen, 2002).
